[Spark Definitive Guide](https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/spark-the-definitive/9781491912201/) - [Spark project](https://spark.apache.org) - [Spark documentation](https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/index.html) - [Data pipelines](https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/data-pipelines-pocket/9781492087823/) - [Next Generation Databases NoSQLand Big Data, Guy Harrison ](https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-1-4842-1329-2) - [Mastering Spark on R](https://therinspark.com) ::: ::: {.column} - [`Parquet`](https://parquet.apache.org) - ['Arrow'](https://arrow.apache.org) - [Dask Docs](https://dask.org/) - [Dask Examples](https://examples.dask.org/) - [Dask Code](https://github.com/dask/dask/) - [Dask Blog](https://blog.dask.org/) - [Pandas cheatsheet](https://pandas.pydata.org/Pandas_Cheat_Sheet.pdf) ::: ::: ## Logistics {{< fa bullhorn >}} `pyspark` {{< fa bullhorn >}} To work the `jupyter` notebooks, install `python 3`, and modules related to `jupyter`: `jupyter-cache`, `jupyter_client`, `jupyter_core`, `jupyterlab_widgets` (this induces the installation of dependencies). Download the jupyter notebooks from [notebooks listings](/notebooks-listings.qmd). {{< fa bullhorn >}} If you do not already have an ENT account, follow instructions on [Moodle](https://moodle.u-paris.fr/course/view.php?id=28534) to get one. You shall need this account to connect to PostGres cluster.
